snippet: While Verdi thought little of the Paris Opera, he wanted to prove himself there. So he composed “Les Vêpres Siciliennes,” performed Saturday at Caramoor in Katonah, N.Y.
abstract: Zachary Woolfe notes that Verdi's operas for French stage are focus of 2013 Bel Canto at Caramoor series; Verdi, who thought little of Paris Opera, nonetheless embraced the French style as he sought to prove himself there.
lead_paragraph: While Verdi thought little of the Paris Opera, he wanted to prove himself there. So he composed “Les Vêpres Siciliennes,” performed Saturday at Caramoor in Katonah, N.Y.

headline.seo: Verdi’s ‘Les Vêpres Siciliennes’: How Paris Helped Him Soar
headline.main: An Italian in Paris: How a New Stage Lifted Verdi
headline.print_headline: An Italian in Paris: How a New Stage Lifted Verdi
